attributes.action: expel the Sudanese Ambassador, Omer Mohammed Ahmed Siddig, in respect of his Country's barbaric treatment of the British School Teacher, Gillian Gibbons.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
On 29th November 2007, Gillian GIBBONS, a School Teacher from Liverpool, was sentenced to 15 days imprisonment in a Sudan jail for naming a Teddy Bear 'Muhammad' whilst teaching in a Sudanese School. 

The following day, thousands of Sudanese citizens took to the streets demanding that Gillian Gibbons should be shot for her conduct. 

The Muslim Council of Britain, an umbrella group of British Muslim organizations, called the sentence "completely unjustified."

We, the undersigned, strongly protest against this barbaric and antagonistic conduct and petition the Prime Minister to expel the Sudanese Ambassador as a mark of this Country's distress at this behaviour.
